content.question: ​Researchers are developing a mathematical function model <math alttext="H"><mi>H</mi></math> to estimate the height of any tree, in meters, based on the tree’s circumference <math alttext="c"><mi>c</mi></math>, in meters, as measured at a height of one meter from base of the tree. Which of the following statements is an assumption about what is consistent in this context?

choices.label: ​Because the model applies to trees in general, trees should simultaneously grow in circumference and height across different tree species.
​Because the model should be used across different geographical environments, the domain of the function is limited by environmental factors.
​Because the model should be used across different geographical environments, the range of the function is limited by atmospheric conditions.
​Because the model should be as consistent as possible, the model must be limited to a single tree species to be valuable.

content.answer: ​Because the model applies to trees in general, trees should simultaneously grow in circumference and height across different tree species.

topic.text: 1.13: Function Model Selection and Assumption Articulation

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Support conclusions or choices with a logical rationale or appropriate data.
